react.title: What is React?
react.content:
What is React?

React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components and manage the state of web applications efficiently.

Example:

import React from 'react';

function App() {
  <div>
    return <h1>Hello, React!</h1>;
  </div>
}

export default App;
Learn more on the official React documentation

html.title: What is HTML?
html.content:
What is HTML?

HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications.

Example:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>My Page</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <h1>Welcome to HTML</h1>
  </body>
</html>
Learn more about HTML

html.title: HTML Tags and Attributes
html.content:
HTML Tags and Attributes

HTML uses tags to define elements and attributes to provide additional information about elements.

Example:

<img src="image.jpg" alt="Example Image" width="300">
Learn more about HTML Elements

html.title: HTML Forms
html.content:
HTML Forms

Forms in HTML are used to collect user input. The <form> element is the container for form controls such as input fields, checkboxes, and submit buttons.

Example:

<form action="/submit" method="post">
  <input type="text" name="username" placeholder="Enter your name" required>
  <button type="submit">Submit</button>
</form>
Learn more about HTML Forms

css.title: What is CSS?
css.content:
What is CSS?

CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. It is used to style and layout web pages, including adjusting fonts, colors, spacing, and positioning.

Example:

body {
  background-color: #f0f0f0;
  color: #333;
  font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
}
Learn more about CSS

css.title: CSS Selectors
css.content:
CSS Selectors

CSS Selectors are patterns used to select the elements you want to style.

Example:

.class-name {
  color: blue;
}
Learn more about CSS Selectors

css.title: CSS Flexbox
css.content:
CSS Flexbox

Flexbox is a layout model that provides an easy way to align and distribute space among items in a container.

Example:

.container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
}
Learn more about Flexbox

react.title: Create a React App
react.content: Create a simple React application using `create-react-app` and display a 'Hello World' message in the browser.

html.title: HTML Form Assignment
html.content: Create a basic HTML form that includes text inputs, a checkbox, and a submit button.

css.title: CSS Flexbox Layout
css.content: Create a responsive web page layout using CSS Flexbox. The page should have a header, content area, and footer, all aligned properly.

react.title: React Blog Website
react.content: Create a simple blog website using React. It should allow users to create, view, and delete blog posts.

html.title: HTML Contact Form
html.content: Create a contact form using HTML that includes fields for name, email, and message, with validation.

css.title: Responsive Portfolio Website
css.content: Create a responsive portfolio website using HTML and CSS that looks good on both mobile and desktop screens.
